description: Survey was taken online or offline. Offline surveys were taken in a supported InWASH application or as part of pilot applications of integrity assessment.
Unique identifer of survey entry.
Date survey was completed and submitted online or recorded offline.
Online survey had 6 pages to complete, 1 for each principle and 1 for final information and contact info. Offline surveys were marked as 6 as they are complete.
Language survey was taken in.
Date survey was launched online. NA for offline surveys
Date last information was entered in survey by the user.
Score for Indicator 1.1 on integrity leadership (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 1.2 on code of conduct (between 1-5)
Means of scores from indicator 1.1 and 1.2, which together make up principle 1: Tone from the top
Score for Indicator 2.1 on integrity risk assessment  (between 1-5)
Means of scores from indicator 2.1, which makes up principle 2: integrity risk assessment
Score for Indicator 3.1 on conflicts of interest (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 3.2 on whistleblowing (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 3.3 on recruitment processes  (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 3.4 on procurement (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 3.5 on code of conduct (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 3.6 on participation (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 3.7 on financial management (between 1-5)
Means of scores from indicator 3.1 through 3.7, which make up principle 3: integrity controls
Score for Indicator 4.1 on disciplinary action against staff (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 2.1 on disciplinary action against contractors  (between 1-5)
Means of scores from indicators 4.1 and 4.2, which make up principle 4: disciplinary action
Score for Indicator 1.1 on integrity risk monitoring (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 1.2 on integrity risk management function review (between 1-5)
Score for Indicator 2.1 on responsiveness to external accountability mechanisms  (between 1-5)
Means of scores from indicators 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, which make up principle 5: risk management monitoring and external accountability
Code identifying each responding service provider or survey user.
Primary model of service provider - public, private or mixed.
Randomly generated country code.
Region of service provider or survey user.

Version of survey that was used. Can be version 1 - the first pilot (with scores mapped to current), version 2 - the second pilot (with scores mapped to current),  or the current version of the survey as it is online and in InWASH toolkit.
